verse_data: न नूनं विद्यतेऽसह्यं मानुष्ये किंचिदेव हि
यत्र त्वं पुरुषव्याघ्र शेषे पांसुषु रूषितः

verse_translation.google_trans: Surely there is nothing unbearable for human beings Where you are, male tiger, angry in the rest of the dust.

verse_data: भूत्वा हि नृपतिः पूर्वं समाज्ञाप्य च मेदिनीम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Becoming the king in the past and after ordering the earth How can you stay today, O King, in a deserted forest

verse_data: दुःशासनं न पश्यामि नापि कर्णं महारथम्

verse_translation.google_trans: I don't see Dushasana nor Karna, the great charioteer Nor are they all friends, O best of the Bharatas.

verse_data: दुःखं नूनं कृतान्तस्य गतिं ज्ञातुं कथंचन
लोकानां च भवान्यत्र शेते पांसुषु रूषितः

verse_translation.google_trans: Suffering is sure to know the movement of fate somehow And you are lying in the dust of the worlds.

verse_data: सतृणं ग्रसते पांसुं पश्य कालस्य पर्ययम्

verse_translation.google_trans: This is the head of the scorcher soaked on the heads Look at the passing of the dust swallowing the grass

verse_data: क्व ते तदमलं छत्रं व्यजनं क्व च पार्थिव
सा च ते महती सेना क्व गता पार्थिवोत्तम

verse_translation.google_trans: Where are your immaculate umbrellas and fans and where is the earth And where is your great army gone, O earthly one.
The motion of the unknowable is certainly the cause of actions Whatever you have become the teacher of the world has gone to this state
Adhruva is the pole in all mortals, and Sri is observed Seeing your calamity, Indra’s rivals are very much aware of it.
Hearing his words, especially the sad one. He said, O king, your son, I have heard this time.
Wiping out of the eyes with tears in his hands, released the tears of grief with his hands Then the king of the men, who was kind to the heroes, then all
This mortal religion is said to be specified by the mother Destruction of all beings

verse_data: सोऽयं मां समनुप्राप्तः प्रत्यक्षं भवतां हि यः

verse_translation.google_trans: So this is the one who has come to me, for you are yours. I have driven this fidelity to rule the earth
Fortunately I have not turned away in battle Fortunately I have been killed by sinful deceitfully

verse_data: उत्साहश्च कृतो नित्यं मया दिष्ट्या युयुत्सता

verse_translation.google_trans: I have always been enthusiastic and always fight Fortunately I have been killed in battle and have killed their relatives in battle
Fortunately I see you free from this decay of the people and the auspicious things that are well-wishers and that is my dearest.

verse_data: यदि वेदाः प्रमाणं वो जिता लोका मयाक्षयाः

verse_translation.google_trans: Don’t be tormented by my friendship with my friendship If the Vedas are the proof, you have conquered the worlds, and I have destroyed the worlds.
Thinking the influence of Krishna of immense splendor Therefore I am not stretched out of the Kshatriya religion and by my own practice

verse_data: स मया समनुप्राप्तो नास्मि शोच्यः कथंचन
यतितं विजये नित्यं दैवं तु दुरतिक्रमम्

verse_translation.google_trans: I have come to him and I am not to be grieved in any way You have done it as if you have a similar manner Try to conquer in victory, but fate is difficult to transgress

verse_data: तूष्णीं बभूव राजेन्द्र रुजासौ विह्वलो भृशम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Having said this, his eyes were overwhelmed with tears. O King, he became silent, and he was overwhelmed with pain.
But seeing the king with tears in his grief Draupadi flared with anger like fire in the world

verse_data: स तु क्रोधसमाविष्टः पाणौ पाणिं निपीड्य च

verse_translation.google_trans: He was angry and pressed his hands in his hand He said this to the king with tears in his tears

verse_data: पिता मे निहतः क्षुद्रैः सुनृशंसेन कर्मणा
न तथा तेन तप्यामि यथा राजंस्त्वयाद्य वै

verse_translation.google_trans: My father was killed by the petty of the good cruel deeds I will not torment him as you are, O king, today.

verse_data: शृणु चेदं वचो मह्यं सत्येन वदतः प्रभो

verse_translation.google_trans: Listen to me if I tell you the truth, Lord. By fulfilling the desired, by charity, righteousness and good deeds
Today I am watching all the Panchalas in the watch For by all means I will take the king of the ghosts But you can give me permission, sir,

verse_data: इति श्रुत्वा तु वचनं द्रोणपुत्रस्य कौरवः

verse_translation.google_trans: Hearing these words of the son of Drona, the Kauravas He spoke the words of compassion for the pleasure of the mind The teacher quick urn and stretched the water
He knew the words of the king, the best of the Brahmins. He took the jug full and approached the king

verse_data: सेनापत्येन भद्रं ते मम चेदिच्छसि प्रियम्

verse_translation.google_trans: The king said to him, “O lord of the worlds, your son. At my command, O best of the twins, let the son of Drona anoint him. If you want my beloved by the commander of the army
The king should be arranged for the sake of the king, especially by a Brahmin. The righteous know thus by the Kshatriya dharma.
Hearing the king's words, Kripa, Sharadvata, then. He anointed Draupadi by the command of the king to the commander of the army
He embraced the king, embracing the king. He set out with the roar of a lion, and all directions were destroyed.
Duryodhana, O king, was also drenched in a stream of blood Then he returned to that night, fearing all beings.
But they quickly departed, therefore, O King, Aayodhana Showing minds, minds, thoughts and meditations
